intro: Pimpinella tragium subsp. tragium, commonly known as the Narrowleaf cowparsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and bipinnate leaves that are finely divided. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Europe and thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its botanical features make it a valuable component of ecological studies and traditional herbal practices.
